themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text contains the standard enactment formula for a public decree, indicating a decision made by the council and the people.
themes.quote: δεδ χθαι τ ι βουλ ι κα τ ι δ μωι

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The inscription honors the people of Kos and specific individuals (judges and a secretary) with golden crowns and public praise for their virtue and service.
themes.quote: πα]ιν σαι τ ν δ [μον τ ν κ ων] ... κα στεφαν σαι α τ ν

themes.label: Agonistic / Victory Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The decree specifies that the honors and crowns are to be announced during the Dionysia festival, specifically during the musical contests.
themes.quote: στεφαν σαι α τ ν το ς πρ τοις διονυσ οις ... το μουσικο] γ νος

persons.name: Judges
persons.role: Foreign judges sent to adjudicate legal cases fairly

persons.name: Secretary
persons.role: Official responsible for administrative duties and documentation

persons.name: Envoy
persons.role: Representative sent to communicate the decree to the people of Kos

persons.name: Agonothetes
persons.role: Organizers of the musical games and festival

rationale: This is a fragmentary honorific decree, likely issued by a foreign city to honor the people of Kos and the judges they sent. The text follows the standard Hellenistic diplomatic protocol: praising the 'kalokagathia' (nobility) of the individuals, awarding golden crowns, and arranging for the proclamation of these honors at the Great Dionysia festival. It also mentions the appointment of an envoy to deliver the news to the Kos council and assembly.
